Behavioral Insight for Public Safety

I am a Clinical Behavioral Specialist with over four years of professional experience at McLean-Franciscan’s psychiatric unit, a Harvard-affiliated hospital. With graduate-level coursework in applied clinical psychology from Boston University and Harvard Extension School, I bring expertise in behavioral assessment, crisis management, and quantitative analysis. Currently transitioning toward law enforcement and public-safety roles, I am committed to applying psychological insight and analytical rigor to complex operational challenges.

Key Competencies

  • Behavioral Assessment: Evaluating behavior to guide informed decision-making.
  • Crisis Management: Safely managing acute, high-stakes situations.
  • Quantitative Analysis: Skilled in SPSS, R, and Excel for data-driven insights.
  • Interdisciplinary Collaboration: Experienced in coordinating clinical and operational teams.

Career Goals

To leverage behavioral science and analytics within public-safety, national security, or investigative organizations, supporting strategic initiatives and operational effectiveness across disciplines.
